intro: Evelyna capitata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clustered inflorescence of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, with five petals, and bloom in the summer months. Evelyna capitata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun.
